project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create a custom status
# Create a workflow for stories that uses the custom status that no subtype issues use. In our case this is called "In Testing".
# Create a story in a project and apply the label "My Label" to the Story.
# Create a filter like the following with the proper project name swapped in: (labels = "My Label" OR type in (subTaskIssueTypes())) AND project = Development ORDER BY Rank
# Verify that the story you created shows up in the filter's results
# Create a board using that filter
# Verify that the custom status you created in step 1 isn't available to be mapped to a column in the board's Columns tab.
# Verify that the story does appear in the board's plan view while it's not in the custom status
# Move the story to the custom status
# Verify that the story no longer appears in the Plan view once it's in the custom status

h3. Current behaviour and workaround

Currently the statuses disappear from the column configuration if you run a filter like the one specified above. A workaround is to explicitly filter the standart types. Here is a comparison:

DOESNT WORK: (labels = "My Label" OR type in (subTaskIssueTypes())) AND project = Development ORDER BY Rank
WORKS FINE: ((labels = "My Label" and type in standardIssueTypes()) OR type in (subTaskIssueTypes())) AND project = Development ORDER BY Rank

As we can see in the second filter, you need to specify that the issues contain the label and are standart issue types OR are subtasks. If you only specify labels OR subtasks, statuses will disappear.

h3. Expected behaviour

Load the statuses as expected
fields.summary: Filters with standard issue types implicitly that allow all sub types explicitly cause the statuses to be unmappeable

Hi,

The Stash developers have recently fixed their Application Links ([STASH-4502|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/STASH-4502]) to use the Display URL, not the Application URL.

This is very useful for those of us running user access via an Apache Proxy, but Application Links still via HTTP (because most Application Links are flakey at best over HTTPS)

When trying to link Confluence pages to Sprints, the normal page assignment functions work (so I've managed to link an existing Meeting Notes), however when I click "Create Page" it tries to redirect to the http url that isn't publically accessible. 

Could this button be changed, like Stash was, to use the Display URL instead of the Application URL?

Thanks,
fields.summary: "Create Page" in Confluence should use "Display URL", not "Application URL"

The fact that the search box only filters by ticket summary is sort of misleading today since the great majority of the JIRA Agile users are also well versed with JIRA and using JQL.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
If a ranking operation fails at the database level (when Active Objects attempt to persist it into the database) it's possible that the instance can get into a state where duplicate log entries exist. This appears to cause ranking to stop updating and means JIRA needs to be restarted to fix the problem.

Whilst this workaround can work OK for smaller companies it affects Enterprise organisations significantly. Can you please enhance JIRA Agile to more gracefully handle this in-product so it doesn't need a workaround?

The workaround is covered in full detail in [How To Fix Issue Ranking Operation log entry found where none expected|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/How+To+Fix+Issue+Ranking+Operation+log+entry+found+where+none+expected].
fields.summary: As an admin I want JIRA Agile to recover more gracefully from database transaction errors

The user "renficiaud" is admin on the space SW in Confluence, and also admin of the Board from which I am trying to create the reports. This user has also the "create report" permissions. 

I raised several issues in the Doc and the Atlassian Questions:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Viewing+the+Sprint+Report
* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/263207/linked-pages-between-agile-and-confluence
* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/125007/issue-links-wiki-page-you-do-not-have-permission-to-view-this-page

It is also the same when I use "admin" which is an admin in Crowd directory in both applications. At least, the error message  "No confluence server is configured" is wrong.
fields.summary: Cannot create report pages on confluence directly from Agile reports

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I have an Agile board setup with 5 columns with some statuses. One particular transition with destination status as *DEV In Progress*, does not automatically (or manually) move the issues under that column. There is not issue with issue going to other statuses and issues moving to the correct column. 
Is this a known bug? How can this issue be resolved?
fields.summary: Issue doesn't show up in the correct column on status change

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: when page was loading plan I clicked work and got that error

h3. Workaround:

Make sure every assignee of the issues in the Sprint backlog used by the Sprint Health Gadget use an uploaded avatar (JIRA avatar or custom avatar) and are not using the automatic letter based Avatars.
fields.summary: Sprint Health Gadget breaks after upgrade to 6.3.11

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Scrolling the mouse while holding a ticket in the plan mode doesn't work

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I recently tried to view the velocity chart for one of my boards and got a red pop-up error message saying *Error: No issues present in sprint to generate scope change model*

However, the sprint looks fine in every other view.

After some investigation, and reading on forums, I updated the filter that the board uses to have the extra clause {{issuetype in standardIssueTypes() AND}}

After adding this clause (and hence excluding sub-tasks) the velocity chart displays ok.

Why are sub-tasks causing a problem?  The team would like to be able to see them on the board, but can't anymore.

This used to work fine - it seems to have happened after the last jira Agile update.
fields.summary: Velocity Charts not displaying when sub-tasks included in filter

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Customer Feedback
{quote}
The new initial added in GH 6.3.11 will cause us more trouble.  We would need to have either the real Initial (first 2 letters of full name?), or a different color for each first letter.

Example we have Martin and Michel they are both the same color in the board.

Thanks

Martin Poirier
Ubisoft Montreal
{quote}

It would be interesting to have the ability to select a specific color for the First Initial avatar.
fields.summary: Users would like the ability to change the First Initial Avatar color however they like

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{{As an Agile board user I would like to hide the days in column on the cards}}

When the "days in column" dots are not required they can be distracting and/or waste screen estate. In some cases they can affect board performance.

h3. COS
* Add a board configuration option in the "columns" section.
* For kanban boards, this feature should ON by default, and for scrum it should be OFF by default.
* Body class / style for sprint support should be updated.

The toggle should allow scrum users to use this feature.

h3. Testing notes:

* Wallboard modes for scrum and kanban boards need to look correct. 
* Consider cards when:
** Estimate badges are there and days in column are.
** Estimate badges are not there and days in column are.
** Estimate badges are there and days in column are not
** Estimate badges are not there and days in column are not
** Test the same on non-wallboard work mode.
* Test cards with long summaries.

h3. Notes

(!) Disabling this functionality will *only* alleviate the performance impact of the JIRA Agile functionality that use the 'days in column'  functionality. It will not alleviate the entire performance problems caused by GHS-9611.

For example threads that can be seen in the below thread dump will perform better if this functionality is disabled, the threads use the {{com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.list.RapidIssueEntryQueryServiceImpl.loadDaysInColumn}} method which is known to cause performance problems.

I noticed that while creating/editing a new issue on my latop, with a smaller screen, that the bitmap to drag/re-size the issue detail panel on the scrum board, planning mode, was on top of the edit form.  I probably wouldn't have noticed it but it was right on top of an edit field and looked like some issue with the edit field.  Like extra '|' characters at the end of the field.

I have just pulled the panel pretty wide open and it normally does not appear under the edit form at normal ( high ) resolution displays or normal ( default ) panel sizes.  But since I was on a laptop with a smaller screen the "drag bitmap" overlapped and since its z-order was top ( or higher ) the drag icon showed about the form.

fields.description:
I run a project with multiple teams, each team has its own sprint.

When I go to 'Complete Sprint' I need the option to be able to send any work that was NOT completed during that sprint to the next sprint for that team, as opposed to returning to the backlog.

Now that sprints are first class citizens in JIRA I'm guessing this should be an easy change.

I'm coming from using the Classic boards - where Releasing a sprint gave the option to 'Move' options that were not 'Done', which is the workflow I require (using Sprints as opposed to Versions!)
fields.summary: As a Scrum Master running multiple sprints, I need to be able to release one sprint in to another, not in to the backlog

fields.description:
When attempting to add a long query (over 255 characters) to the "work sub-filter" on the "General" configuration screen for a Kanban board and click update you will get a general error message come up and it will not let you save. If you then check the catalina.out file you will find a long error message in which is the following:

{code}
Caused by: com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlDataTruncation: Data trucation: Data too long for column 'QUERY' at row 1
{code}

To work around this issue I changed the column length of the "query" column to 2000 characters and this worked around the issue successfully.

Workaround :
Create a saved query with the JQL you want to use in the work sub-filter and reference that saved query from within the work sub-filter
fields.summary: Data truncation issue on Kanban board configuration - Work sub-filter

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Original summary: {{Need a way to distinguish between new tickets and previously prioritized tickets}}

Because of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-6905, it's now very difficult to keep the Backlog prioritized.  People implicitly prioritize their tickets inadvertently by adding them into the middle of the backlog.

For my team, it's important to have a distinction between a Backlog, which is prioritized, and a list of new bugs which have not yet been prioritized.

I'd like to suggest adding a new group separate from the backlog, where all new tickets go.  It could be called something along the lines of "Needs Triage" or similar to indicate that these bugs have not yet been prioritized.  New bugs would go into this grouping, until they get prioritized in the backlog.
fields.summary: Distinguish new issues and previously prioritized issues

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
There is no easy way at the moment to see the size of the backlog in story points, and progress towards it from a project perspective.

The velocity charts in the Reports tabs are nice, but since we release at the end of each sprint, and have to use the Version field to store the release number, we can't use the velocity charts to show a picture of the whole project.

I'd like to see either:
* Another option on the Version Report to show "All" - i.e a single burnup chart regardless of version
* An additional tab on "Reports" that says "Projects" and allows you to see the burnup for an individual project, or multiple projects (i.e. the ability to multi-select from the list of projects that are included in your filter)

Note that this is distinct from GHS-5513, which relates to sprint level burnup charts (although many of the comments there are complaining of a lack of a project level view)
fields.summary: As a Product Owner, I want to see a burnup chart for the Project (not sprint or version)

fields.description:
h3. Issue
When starting a sprint which contains issues that have been closed/resolved BEFORE the sprint starts, these done issues are being shown on the agile board in work mode, as well as in the reports (burndown, sprint report).

h3. Expected
- When activating a sprint, only open tickets should be pulled in.
- Issues that have been closed before the sprint started, should not be  displayed in the reports and boards.

h3. Steps to reproduce
- Create a sprint on a SCRUM board
- Create a new Issue and pull it into the sprint in Plan View
- Close the Issue (f.e. resolution: Duplicate)
- Start the sprint 
- The closed issue and its story points will show up on the board in work mode as well as in the reports
fields.summary: Formerly Closed Issues show up once the planned sprint gets started

h3. Workaround

Verify that *all* screen schemes have a default issue operation. If they do not have one, add it with the *Associate an Issue Operation with a Screen* button.

h3. Notes

The {{CustomFieldScreenServiceImpl#addFieldForIssueOperation}} is not catching the exception thrown by JIRA when there is no issue operation defined for a screen scheme (very unlikely, but possible)
fields.summary: Sprint field upgrade task blows up when a screen scheme doesn't have any issue operations

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: When I press "Agile" with a touch screen to access one of the Agile boards, it will open and then immediately close the menu when using touch. With click, it stays open and I can then click on one of the board.
fields.summary: Ability to open top menu with touch

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
During jira + jira-agile upgrade jira performed  one re-indexing just after (or during) jira upgrade. It required re-indexing once again after jira-agile (GreenHopper) upgrade (2-nd time). After that some sub tasks where not shown in boards. There was no errors in logs during all upgrade activity. Application restart and one more re-indexing was performed to fix boards.
So, re-indexing was performed 3 times.

As far as jira-agile upgrade doesn't require jira restart (according to upgrade guide)  this looks as a bug. It seams that Event listener classes can't be updated for plugin modules on the fly and require jira restart. 
Not sure if this relates to this particular problem.
fields.summary: JIRA-AGILE require 3 re-indexing during upgrade

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: jira how to reuse or copy an existing boards template on jira

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I keep my Kanban columns sorted by Rank, but if I have sub-task JIRAs, the board UI forces sibling sub-tasks to be grouped and only allows you to change their Rank among their sibling sub-tasks. The only way I've found to change sub-tasks' Rank is by changing the Rank of their parent task.

For example, I have these tickets:

    LAYOUT-5541 - regular ticket
    PENGDEV-153 - parent ticket
    PENGDEV-155 - sub-task of PENGDEV-153
    PENGDEV-156 - sub-task of PENGDEV-153

My board always displays PENGDEV-155 and PENGDEV-156 next to each other, so I can't rank my tickets like this:

1) PENGDEV-155
2) LAYOUT-5541
3) PENGDEV-156

This is a pretty big pain. Or is there a way to do this that I just haven't found?
fields.summary: Kanban - Allow Changing Sub-tasks' Ranks Independently

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
There's a problem when creating sub-tasks using the Classic Planning Board.

When creating a sub-task, setting the Component to one with a "Default Assignee" rule, and setting the assignee to "Auto Assign", the new sub-task will be assigned to "Unassigned" instead of the Component's Default Assignee.

This occurs even when the JIRA setting "Allow unassigned issues" is off.
fields.summary: Classic Boards Don't Respect Component Assignee Rules When Using Auto-Assign

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Go to _Agile > Manage Board_ and create a new board.
# Create a new Scrum Board select "New project and a new board".
# Put board name as "Parent Issue" and project name as "ViewOnBoard".
# board filter will be:
{code} project = ViewOnBoard ORDER BY Rank ASC {code}
# Create 3 new issues with its sub-task.
# Go back to _Agile > Manage Board_ and copy the "Parent Issue" board.
# Then, create another scrum board called "Child Issues" and select "Existing Project" choose the "ViewOnBoard" project.
# After the board is created, go to _Board > Configure Board_.
# In general tab, edit the filter query to the below query and save.
{code} project = ViewOnBoard AND issuetype = Sub-task ORDER BY Rank ASC {code}
# Choose one of the sub-tasks and click the "View on Board".

*Expected Result:*
The board name should be listed in "Go To Board" window.

*Actual Result:*
Only the board for the parent issue is listed even though the sub-task is displayed in "Work" board.
fields.summary: Board Name for Sub-Task not showing on View on Board/Go To Board window.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Selected the Agile planning board.
A large number of epics exist but only a few have been assigned to the current version (say 1.0)
upon selecting this particular version (in the versions tab) all the Epics which are NOT in this version are still visible but are greyed out.

This makes managing Epics and stories in selected version difficult as you still have a large number of Epics still in the list.

upon selecting a particular version, only the Epics with this 'fix version' should be displayed. All others should be removed.
fields.summary: Selecting a version in the Agile board only 'greys' out other Epics

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We upgraded Jira/Agile last week and got a notice that:  "This version of JIRA Agile requires sprints on Scrum boards to be migrated."

We really need a generic query to identify which Jira tickets were affected.  Some of our tickets beloned to more than one sprint at a time.  

Thanks!
George
fields.summary: Need a query to identify issues affected for sprints on Scrum boards that were migrated

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Reviewing the Agile Gadget burndown for my project (i am using the fix version field to show burndowns per month), i see that the top right progress bar shows different number of open issues 16, compared to the solid green line of remaining values which shows 19. I am trying to understand the difference.

Also, for the same filter and same start date and end date, the chart returns different end values. On 3/3, the value was 103, today was showing 50. I am attaching 3 screenshots displaying the issue.
fields.summary: Agile Gadget Remaining Issues line do not match numbers in top corner progress bar

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
My browser is Google Chrome

fields.description:
Creating issues in JIRA sets ranking inconsistently.

h4. Steps to Replicate the Problem:
* Creating an Issue from a view other than the Planning Board (e.g. from the dashboard) causes the issue to appear at the bottom of the Planning View.
* When creating it from the Planning View, the new ticket will automatically appear underneath whichever ticket is currently selected.
* If no ticket is selected in the Planning View and a new ticket is added, that ticket will appear at the TOP of the backlog. To reproduce, just manually remove the {{selectedIssue=XXX}} query string parameter from the Planning View URL and try to create a new ticket.

h4. Expected Behavior:
Creating a new issue should put it to the bottom of the backlog at all times, to prevent accidentally giving the issue a priority.

Ref.: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/198381/configuring-new-issue-planning-board-position
fields.summary: "Create Issue" Sets Rank Randomly

fields.description: When a user attempt to move a Tempo work log from one issue to another an Error window appears.  The log is not moved.   View with the action in Firebug indicates that a 404 error is returned by the action.  Nothing is written to the Jira log as a result of this.   A screen shot is attached indicating the error window.  One thing of note in the Move worklog window,  it looks like the $issue.key variable isn't being resolved.
fields.summary: Moving a Tempo work log generates an error

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As of now, under _Configure Board > Estimate_ it's possible to select a field that isn't configured for Issues included in the board. It would be good if Agile checked whether the field is available in Projects included in the board and displayed an information if that isn't the case.

+Example:+ Business Value field is only configured for Project A, but can still be selected as the estimate for a board created for Project B. No warning will show, the estimate tooltips for any of the Issues just won't be displayed.
fields.summary: A warning should be displayed when estimation field is unavailable
